intro: Silene filipes subsp. amassiensis, commonly known as the Amassien sandstem, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
